excerpt: Built entirely with hand-hewn wood carvings, this still unfinished 20-story complex offers tours.
detail_description: Sanctuary of Truth is a 20-story complex made entirely of hand-hewn wood carvings, still under construction but open for tours. Similar to the Tibetan sand mandala art, this massive teak structure is a blend of architecture and philosophy, depicting lessons from various religions emphasizing respect for elders, choosing company wisely, and treating others well. It serves as a remarkable place for reflection on higher ideals and the impermanence of life.
name: Sanctuary of Truth
address: 206, 2 Pattaya-Na Kluea Rd, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: This 500-acre attraction offers a variety of themed gardens, elephant shows & rides, plus an eatery.
detail_description: Nong Nooch Botanical Garden is a sprawling 500-acre attraction that offers a diverse range of experiences. In addition to its themed gardens showcasing Thai culture, it features elephant shows and rides, as well as a variety of dining options. The garden is one of the largest botanical gardens in Southeast Asia and boasts an array of plant species, including orchids, bonsai trees, and cacti. Visitors can also enjoy performances, activities, and even explore a small zoo within the expansive grounds.
name: Nong Nooch Botanical Garden
address: 34, Na Chom Thian, Sattahip District, Chon Buri 20250, Thailand

excerpt: Indoor aquarium showcasing Thailand's marine life, with a 100-meter underwater tunnel & shark dives.
detail_description: Underwater World Pattaya is the city's sole aquarium, offering a diverse showcase of Thailand's marine life. Despite its smaller size compared to other aquariums, it boasts an impressive array of sea creatures from various underwater environments. Visitors can engage in unique experiences such as feeding koi fish from bottles, encountering sharks and rays up close, and exploring Thailand's largest collection of jellyfish.
name: Underwater World Pattaya
address: 22, 22 หมู่ 11 Sukhumvit Rd, ตำบล หนองปรือ Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Colorful market with traditional Thai crafts & produce sold from boats & waterfront shops.
detail_description: Pattaya Floating Market is a vibrant and popular attraction that offers a unique shopping experience. It combines the charm of traditional Thai floating markets with the convenience of a reconstructed setting, making it safe and easy to navigate. Visitors can explore a wide range of high-quality goods, including clothing, handicrafts, art, and jewelry. The market also features cultural demonstrations and opportunities to dine on delicious Thai cuisine from various regions of the country.
name: Pattaya Floating Market
address: 451, 304 หมู่ที่ 12 Sukhumvit Rd, ตำบล บางละมุง, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: High-energy promenade abuzz nightly with go-go bars, souvenir shops, restaurants & discos.
detail_description: Walking Street in Pattaya, Thailand is a vibrant and lively promenade that comes alive at night. Spanning a full kilometer from Beach Road to Bali Hai Plaza, it is lined with an array of entertainment options including go-go bars, nightclubs, beer bars, and restaurants. The surrounding side streets offer even more choices for nightlife enthusiasts. From karaoke bars to sports bars and discotheques, there's something for everyone here.
name: Walking St
address: Muang Pattaya, Amphoe Bang Lamung, Chang Wat Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Tree-lined 6-km. stretch of sand offering loungers, bars, restaurants & water sports.
detail_description: Jomtien Beach, also known as Chom Thian, is a serene 6-km stretch of sand lined with trees and offering various amenities such as loungers, bars, restaurants, and water sports. The beach provides uninterrupted views of Pattaya Bay and the surrounding area. Visitors can explore the hilltop viewpoint which offers panoramic views of Pattaya and Jomtien at any time of the day.
name: Jomtien Beach
address: Chon Buri, Thailand

excerpt: Family entertainment venue with haunted houses, a theater with moving seats & an oddities museum.
detail_description: Ripley's Believe It or Not! Pattaya is an exciting family entertainment venue located in the heart of Pattaya city. The museum offers a variety of attractions including a theater with moving seats, haunted houses, laser maze, horror hospital, and infinity maze. Inside the museum, visitors can explore over 10 galleries with more than 350 exhibits from around the world.
name: Ripley's Believe It or Not!
address: 218 Beach Rd, Pattaya City, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Attraction housing miniature models of renowned Thai & international monuments, with on-site cafe.
detail_description: Mini Siam is a captivating miniature park that showcases scaled-down replicas of famous landmarks and historical buildings from Thailand's rich history as well as iconic sites from around the world. Visitors can marvel at miniatures of renowned cultural sites such as Wat Arun, Ananta Samakhom Throne Hall, and Wat Phra Kaew, alongside European landmarks like the Tower Bridge and the Eiffel Tower. The park offers a unique opportunity to feel like a giant while exploring these intricate models.
name: Mini Siam
address: 387 Sukhumvit Rd, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Family-friendly park with high-speed water slides, wave pools, kiddie areas & a floating market.
detail_description: Ramayana Water Park is a top destination for families, offering an array of thrilling water slides, wave pools, and attractions suitable for all ages. Located just 10 minutes from Pattaya beach in the picturesque Silver Lake area, this expansive park boasts 21 exhilarating rides, including unique experiences not found elsewhere in Asia. Visitors can enjoy everything from high-speed slides to relaxing in private cabanas while savoring the diverse food offerings.
name: Ramayana Water Park
address: 9 หมู่ที่ 7 Ban Yen Rd, Na Chom Thian, Sattahip District, Chon Buri 20250, Thailand

excerpt: Lounge chairs line this bustling beach with water sports like parasailing & restaurants nearby.
detail_description: Pattaya Beach is a bustling and popular destination with a 4 km crescent-shaped coast divided into three zones: north, center, and south. Visitors can enjoy lounging on beach chairs, engaging in water sports like parasailing, or exploring the nearby restaurants and shops.
name: Pattaya Beach
address: Chon Buri, Thailand

detail_description: Art Corner Pattaya is a must-visit for art enthusiasts and curious travelers alike. Unlike traditional galleries, this unique museum encourages visitors to become part of the artwork through optical illusions and clever tricks. With over a hundred 3D paintings spanning 5,800 square meters, the museum creates immersive scenes that ignite creativity and imagination. From crossing ancient bridges to flying on magic carpets, visitors can step into vibrant and realistic paintings, making it an incredible experience for all.
name: Art Corner Pattaya
address: 191, 20 Thappraya Rd, Pattaya City, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Hilltop religious site with a famed colossal Buddha statue & a staircase flanked by huge dragons.
detail_description: Wat Phra Yai, also known as Big Buddha Hill, is a hilltop religious site located in south Pattaya. It features an 18-meter tall Buddha statue and a staircase flanked by huge dragons. The temple complex includes other popular temples like Wat Yansangwararam Woramahawihan, Wat Khao Phra Bat Temple, and Wat Pa Pradu. Visitors can enjoy the serene ambiance and panoramic views of Pattaya and its coastline from this elevated location.
name: Wat Phra Yai
address: 384 Regent Soi 2, Pattaya City, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Lakeside temple housing statues of fighting monks & a museum of ancient Chinese painting & pottery.
detail_description: Anek Kusala Sala, also known as Viharn Sien, is a stunning lakeside temple that serves as both an art gallery and a museum. Originally built to commemorate the King's birthday and foster Chinese-Thai relations, it now showcases a fusion of both cultures. The museum features over 300 artworks including statues of historical figures and religious deities, as well as brass and bronze sculptures depicting common people from ancient times.
name: Anek Kusala Sala (Viharn Sien)
address: QXQ4+44G, Pattaya City, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Cultural village offering elephant & ox-cart rides, Thai dance shows & silk-weaving demonstrations.
detail_description: Pattaya Elephant Village is a cultural sanctuary that offers various activities such as elephant and ox-cart rides, traditional Thai dance shows, and silk-weaving demonstrations. It serves as a haven for rescued and retired elephants, promoting conservation and responsible tourism. Visitors can engage in ethical interactions with the elephants, including feeding, bathing, and leisurely rides through the scenic surroundings. The village provides an educational experience while emphasizing the well-being of these magnificent creatures.
name: Pattaya Elephant Village
address: 48, 120, Pattaya City, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

detail_description: Tiffany's Show Pattaya is a grand cabaret performance that showcases dazzling costumes, energetic music, and meticulously choreographed routines. The show features talented performers who are ladyboys, known for their flawless acts and extravagant stage presence. With rapid scene changes and state-of-the-art stage designs, the show offers a larger-than-life experience with glittering outfits adorned with sequins, rhinestones, and feathers.
name: Tiffany's Show Pattaya
address: 464 หมู่ที่ 9, Pattaya Sai Song Rd, ตำบล หนองปรือ, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Visitors can pose for photos with exotic animals at this 70-acre site that also features live shows.
detail_description: Experience the awe-inspiring Million Years Stone Park & Pattaya Crocodile Farm, located just a short distance from Na Klua Beach. This 70-acre site boasts an extensive collection of ancient stones and petrified trees, creating a picturesque setting for visitors to explore and take photos. The park also features live shows with ferocious crocodiles, including talent displays and adrenaline-pumping performances.
name: The Million Years Stone Park & Pattaya Crocodile Farm
address: 22, Nong Pla Lai, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Theater presenting dance shows with colorfully costumed transgender performers & high-tech lighting.
detail_description: Experience the dazzling extravaganza of the Alcazar Cabaret Show, a renowned theater featuring vibrant dance performances by transgender artists adorned in elaborate costumes and enhanced by state-of-the-art lighting. The show, performed by kathoeys or ladyboys, offers a captivating glimpse into Thailand's unique cultural history.
name: Alcazar Cabaret Show
address: 78, WVVQ+WRX, 14 Pattaya Sai Song Rd, ตำบล หนองปรือ, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

detail_description: Pattaya Water Park, located in the heart of Pattaya, offers a thrilling experience for families and adventure seekers. With attractions like a 50-foot inflatable waterslide, zorb racers, and challenging obstacle courses inspired by the TV show Wipeout, it's perfect for older kids and teens. For those seeking an adrenaline rush, this park is not to be missed.
name: Pattaya Water Park
address: 345 หมู่ที่ 12, ตำบล หนองปรือ, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Unique hands-on museum with dioramas, dinosaurs, 3-D safari & ocean-themed scenes & other exhibits.
detail_description: Art In Paradise Pattaya is a captivating and interactive museum covering 5,800 square meters and featuring over a hundred 3D paintings. Visitors can immerse themselves in the art by posing with the vivid and realistic artworks, which include dioramas, dinosaurs, safari scenes, ocean-themed displays, and portraits of influential figures. The museum offers an engaging experience for both kids and adults, inviting them to take creative photos with the larger-than-life paintings.
name: Art In Paradise Pattaya
address: หมู่ที่ 9, 78/34, Pattaya Sai Song Rd, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Creative place with a large collection of teddy bears posed in playful scenes, plus a gift shop.
detail_description: The Teddy Bear Museum, located in the Bang Lamung District of Thailand's Chon Buri Province, is a unique and creative destination for teddy bear enthusiasts. This museum, also known as Teddy Bear Island, features over 2,000 dolls and teddy bears displayed in twelve different picture zones. What sets this museum apart is that visitors can interact with the teddy bears without any glass barriers.
name: Teddy Bear Museum
address: 436/49 หมู่ที่ 9 ซอย, 1 Beach Rd, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

detail_description: The Thepprasit Night Market, also known as the Pattaya Weekend Market or Kankeha Thepprasit Market, is a bustling and popular night market in Pattaya. Open from Friday to Sunday evenings, it offers a wide variety of goods including clothing, accessories, souvenirs, and electronics at affordable prices. Visitors can explore colorful stalls and permanent stores while enjoying local street food.
name: Thepprasit Night Market
address: 18 Thepprasit Rd, Pattaya City, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

detail_description: Wong Amat Beach is a tranquil and secluded spot near Naklua beach in Pattaya. Unlike the bustling Pattaya Beach, Wong Amat offers a quieter and cleaner environment, perfect for those seeking relaxation away from the crowds and noisy activities. Visitors can enjoy a peaceful stroll along the shore or bask in the sun without disturbances.
name: Wong Amat Beach
address: Muang Pattaya, 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Huge, elaborate ice sculptures are the main draw at this indoor-outdoor attraction with a bar.
detail_description: Frost Magical Ice of Siam is a unique indoor-outdoor attraction in Pattaya, featuring elaborate ice sculptures and a bar. It's the first ice dome in the area, offering visitors a chance to experience Thailand's rich culture with an international twist. The park covers over 30,000 sqm and showcases various zones displaying Thai tradition, including the Himmapan zone with mystical creatures and culture. Visitors can enjoy photography opportunities and even slide down an ice sculpture.
name: FROST Magical Ice of Siam
address: 75, 6, Nong Pla Lai, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

detail_description: Pop Art Thailand is a vibrant destination that celebrates the world of pop art through stunning visual experiences. With branches in Bangkok and Chiang Mai, this illusion art museum offers an exciting atmosphere perfect for families and couples looking to capture memorable moments. Visitors can personalize their own artwork, making it an ideal spot for unique gifts or home decor. The gallery features beautiful pieces that are not only visually striking but also allow guests to create custom designs using personal photos.
name: Pop Art Thailand
address: 454/59 Mo 10, 108 Soi Khopai 9, Pattaya City, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Movie-themed amusement park featuring waterslides, pools & a variety of dining options.
detail_description: Step into the world of your favorite Columbia Pictures movies at Columbia Pictures Aquaverse, a movie-themed amusement park that offers a unique blend of water-based attractions and iconic film experiences. Located just 20 minutes from a luxury hotel in Pattaya, this immersive water park features over 150 attractions inspired by blockbuster hits like Jumanji, Ghostbusters, and Hotel Transylvania.
name: Columbia Pictures Aquaverse
address: 888 หมู่ 8 Sukhumvit Rd, Na Chom Thian, Sattahip District, Chon Buri 20250, Thailand

detail_description: If you're in Thailand, a visit to the Elephant Jungle Sanctuary Pattaya is a must. This sanctuary promotes ethical treatment of elephants and offers visitors the chance to interact with these majestic creatures in a sustainable manner. With trained English-speaking guides providing insights into elephant behavior and history, visitors can enjoy activities like bathing and feeding the elephants by hand. It's a great opportunity to bond with nature while supporting responsible wildlife tourism.
name: Office Elephant Jungle Sanctuary Pattaya
address: Office 3, 347 Pattaya 3rd Rd, Pattaya City, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

detail_description: Tuxedo Illusion Hall offers a captivating forty-five-minute magic show that is perfect for families and magic enthusiasts alike. The hall features a variety of optical illusions and tricks that will leave you in awe. The beautifully decorated venue and spacious seating arrangement provide the perfect setting for an unforgettable experience. With effective lighting, sound, and talented magicians performing mind-boggling tricks, this classic magic show is sure to entertain both kids and adults.
name: Tuxedo Illusion Hall
address: WVWQ+PWV, Pattaya Sai Song Rd, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

detail_description: Art Street is a must-visit destination in Pattaya, Thailand for art enthusiasts. It features an array of small art shops and tattoo studios, showcasing impressive paintings, drawings, framing, and graphic designs. Visitors can explore the street's vibrant artistic offerings while enjoying the cool collections on display. Additionally, Art in Paradise offers an interactive 3D art experience suitable for all ages.
name: ART STREET
address: Thailand, Chon Buri, Bang Lamung District, Pattaya City, Pattaya 11

excerpt: Attraction featuring a giant carved picture of the Buddha on a limestone cliff face.
detail_description: Khao Chi Chan, also known as Buddha Mountain, is a famous landmark in Na Chom Thian, just 15 km from Pattaya. The highlight of this attraction is the impressive 109-meter-tall golden Buddha laser engraving on a limestone hill. This remarkable site was created to commemorate King Rama IX's 50-year reign and has become a religious and cultural symbol.
name: Khao Chi Chan
address: Na Chom Thian, Sattahip District, Chon Buri 20250, Thailand

excerpt: Temple atop a hill with an 18-m. golden Buddha, elaborate staircase & views over Pattaya Bay.
detail_description: Phra Tamnak Mountain Viewpoint, also known as Wat Phra Yai, is a temple situated on the lush Khao Phra Bat hill offering stunning views of Pattaya City and its shores. The iconic Golden Buddha statue sits atop the mountain, providing panoramic vistas of the bustling city and bay below. Visitors can enjoy the elaborate staircase leading to the temple and take in the breathtaking scenery from this elevated vantage point.
name: Phra Tamnak Mountain Viewpoint
address: เขา, Phra Tamnak, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

detail_description: Embark on a day excursion to Pattaya Coral Island by Sea Tours, where you can explore the nearby Koh Larn. This island is renowned for its crystal-clear waters and picturesque beaches, making it an ideal destination for a day of relaxation and water activities.
name: Pattaya Coral Island by Sea Tours
address: Bali Hai Pier, Pattaya City, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Attraction offering petting sessions & photo opportunities with tigers of various sizes & ages.
detail_description: Tiger Park Pattaya is a unique attraction where visitors can interact with tigers of various sizes and ages, offering petting sessions and photo opportunities. It's an exciting opportunity to get up close with these majestic creatures in a safe environment. This experience sets it apart from other attractions in the area, making it a must-visit for animal lovers and thrill-seekers alike.
name: Tiger Park Pattaya
address: 349, 9 Sukhumvit Rd, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

detail_description: Terminal 21 Pattaya, established in 2018, is a renowned department store located in the heart of Pattaya City. This retail mall follows the concept of 'Happiness of the East' and features a 'World Market Street' theme that brings together iconic cities from around the world under one roof, including Paris, London, Italy, Tokyo, San Francisco, and Hollywood.
name: Terminal 21 Pattaya
address: 777, 1, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Happening mall with 2 well-known museums in addition to international chain stores & some cafes.
detail_description: Royal Garden Plaza is a vibrant mall in Pattaya that introduced the concept of an entertainment mall. It offers a mix of family attractions, renowned museums, dining options, and international brand stores. The mall spans three floors and features well-known international and Thai clothing brands, 4D cinemas, beauty salons, and sports outlets. Visitors can also admire an eye-catching mock airplane at the entrance on 2nd Road.
name: Royal Garden Plaza
address: 218 Beach Rd, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Lively market with 250+ stalls for clothing, shoes, luggage, jewelry, Thai souvenirs & more.
detail_description: Pattaya Night Bazaar is a bustling market featuring over 250 stalls offering a wide range of products including clothing, shoes, luggage, jewelry, and Thai souvenirs. The market provides a covered and air-conditioned shopping experience, making it more comfortable for visitors. While it is known as a night bazaar, the shops are also open during the day with local vendors setting up their stalls at night. Visitors can enjoy leisurely shopping without being exhausted by the sun.
name: Pattaya Night Bazaar
address: 519/106 หมู่ที่ 10, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Outdoor venue offering trained dolphin shows & activities like swimming with the dolphins.
detail_description: Pattaya Dolphin World is a delightful outdoor venue that promises an unforgettable experience for the entire family. Here, you can witness captivating dolphin shows featuring these intelligent creatures, along with the charming Brazilian seals that are sure to steal your heart. For those seeking a more personal encounter, sitting in the front row allows you to interact closely with these playful animals—imagine kissing their cheeks and snapping selfies! But that's just the beginning of the fun at Pattaya Dolphin World.
name: Pattaya Dolphin World
address: 44/8 ม.9, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Unique attraction featuring a large Buddha image carved into a the wall of a mountain.
detail_description: Nestled near the enchanting Nong Nooch Botanical Garden, Khao Chi Chan Buddha, also known as Buddha Mountain, stands as a remarkable testament to artistry and devotion in Pattaya. This awe-inspiring landmark features an enormous seated Buddha image carved into the limestone face of a mountain, measuring an impressive 130 meters tall and 70 meters wide.
name: พระพุทธรูปแกะสลักหน้าผาเขาชีจรรย์
address: Soi Khao Chi Chan, Na Chom Thian, Sattahip District, Chon Buri 20250, Thailand

excerpt: Expansive ocean beach offering calm waters for swimming, chair rentals & a kids' playground.
detail_description: Ban Amphur Beach is a serene and uncrowded ocean beach located in a quiet fishing village. The beach offers calm waters for swimming, chair rentals, and a kids' playground. With its beautiful sand, palm trees, and ample parking, it provides a peaceful escape from the bustling beaches of Pattaya. Visitors can enjoy delicious and fresh seafood from the various restaurants in the fishing harbor at reasonable prices due to lower tourism impact.
name: Ban Amphur Beach
address: Thailand, Amphoe Sattahip, Chang Wat Chon Buri 20250, Thailand

excerpt: Tours are available of this sprawling winery with gardens, an amphitheater & a restaurant/bar.
detail_description: Silverlake Vineyard offers tours of its expansive grounds, featuring gardens, an amphitheater, and a restaurant/bar. Visitors can enjoy wine tasting and delicious food while capturing perfect photo moments. The vineyard provides insight into the wine production process, from grape cultivation to wine making, specializing in New Latitude Wines. Surrounded by wooded hills and the stunning Buddha Mountain, the Italian-inspired architecture adds to the charm of this rural site resembling the Italian countryside.
name: Silverlake Vineyard
address: 31/62 Moo 7 Na-Jomthian na jomthian, Sattahip District, Chon Buri 20250, Thailand

excerpt: Marine life entertainment complex with shows, swimming & up-close encounters with seals & dolphins.
detail_description: Dolphinarium Pattaya is a marine life entertainment complex that offers visitors the chance to witness adorable dolphin shows, swim with dolphins, and have up-close encounters with seals. Located not far from Bangkok, it's easily accessible for a refreshing experience. The facility is dedicated solely to dolphins and offers activities such as shows, feeding sessions, special adventures, and open dining. It's an ideal destination for families or friends looking to spend quality time together while learning about these intelligent and lovely creatures.
name: Pattaya Dolphinarium
address: 555, 5, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

detail_description: Pattaya View Point, also known as Khao Pattaya View Point, is located about 800 meters from Big Buddha Hill. From this vantage point on Pratumnak Hill, visitors can enjoy breathtaking panoramic views of Pattaya and Jomtien beaches. The changing lights in the late afternoon enhance the already stunning scenery. It's a great spot to capture memorable photos and witness beautiful sunsets.
name: Pattaya View Point (Pattaya City Sign)
address: WVC8+CMW, ซอย หมู่บ้านวิวพอยท์, Pattaya City, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Bustling covered market featuring a variety of vendors selling local grub, clothing & accessories.
detail_description: Pattaya Park Night Market is a lively and bustling covered market located near Jomtien Beach, offering a variety of goods from local grub to clothing and accessories. The market has a relaxed atmosphere with loud music, attracting tourists, expats, and locals alike. It features good value street food stalls, international food options, pop-up bars selling cheap beer and alcohol. Additionally, visitors can find boutique clothing, footwear, beachwear, accessories as well as souvenirs.
name: Pattaya Park Night Market
address: Pattaya City, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

detail_description: Nestled in the charming fishing village of Naklua, Mum Aroi is a delightful seafood restaurant offering a fantastic variety of dishes. Situated by the sea, diners can enjoy picturesque views of old fishing boats on the waves while savoring their meals. This popular spot is frequented by both expats and locals, often bustling with activity in the evenings.
name: Mum Aroi
address: Na Chom Thian, Sattahip District, Chon Buri 20250, Thailand

name: Kidzooona Central Festival Pattaya
address: WVMM+X4F, Unnamed Road, Pattaya City, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Hillside landmark featuring the town name in giant letters & a platform with sweeping beach vistas.
detail_description: Pattaya City Sign is a prominent landmark situated on a hillside, featuring the city's name in large letters and offering a platform with stunning views of the beach. This vibrant seaside resort in Thailand boasts numerous attractions, including Mini Siam theme park and bustling nightlife spots. Visitors can explore Pattaya Night Bazaar for shopping or indulge in diverse dining options.
name: Pattaya City Sign
address: 171 หมู่ที่ 6 ถนน พัทยาเหนือ, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

detail_description: Central Marina is a shopping center conveniently located near S@S Pattaya. It has a unique design resembling a fisherman's village and offers various amenities such as a cinema, 24-hour McDonald's, Big C supermarket, and a Nike factory outlet. The mall also features popular dining options like Starbucks, MK, Auntie Anne's, Swensen's, and Pizza Hut.
name: Central Marina Outlet
address: 78/54 Pattaya Sai Song Rd, ตำบล หนองปรือ, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20260, Thailand

excerpt: Whimsical farm featuring sheep, birds, animal shows, games & colorful playscapes for children.
detail_description: Family Park Pattaya, established in 2013, is the largest sheep farm in Thailand and offers a unique opportunity for visitors to interact with adorable sheep. The farm features various activities such as bottle-feeding milk to the animals, trampoline fun, and pony rides for children.
name: Family Park Pattaya
address: XXFG+6GR, 73, Nong Pla Lai, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Lively center for the local nightlife, this street is lined with shops, restaurants & nightclubs.
detail_description: Beach Rd, also known as Pattaya Beach Road, is a vibrant hub for both locals and tourists. During the day, it's packed with visitors exploring shops, restaurants, and bars. At night, the area comes alive with a bustling nightlife scene featuring numerous bars, pubs, and nightclubs where you can enjoy live entertainment and socialize with friends. The street is also a hotspot for various activities such as street performances by magicians and musicians, art exhibitions, comedy shows, and more.
name: Beach Rd
address: Muang Pattaya, Amphoe Bang Lamung, Chang Wat Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Long-running attraction in a park offering both a bungee jump & human slingshot experience.
detail_description: Located in Jomtien, Pattaya Bungy Jump is a well-known and enduring park attraction that offers thrilling activities for adventure seekers. Alongside bungee jumping, visitors can also experience the exhilarating Xbungy, which involves leaping from a 60-meter high platform and feeling the rush of wind as they descend towards the lake surface. This facility is staffed by skilled professionals who prioritize safety and ensure that each participant is securely strapped in before taking the plunge.
name: Xbungy - Pattaya Bungy Jump
address: 380, 105 ซอย 9, Muang Pattaya, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand

excerpt: Buddhist temple complex with resident monks on 10-acres, founded in 1937, with a massage school.
detail_description: The Wat Chai Mongkron Buddhist temple complex is located in the heart of Pattaya, and is home to many practicing monks. The temple has a authentic feel, and is popular with tourists.
name: Wat Chai Mongkhon
address: 27 หมู่ที่ 10 S Pattaya Rd, ตำบล หนองปรือ, Bang Lamung District, Chon Buri 20150, Thailand
